*Regression*
The "Create Issue" help-tip (shown below), when not yet dismissed by user, doesn't display on all pages. This includes:
* Dashboard page
* Issue Nav page
* View Issue page

!create_issue_helptip.png!

*Other notes from investigation*:
* "Create Issue" help-tip appears on the Project Summary page (with / without common header)
* No JS errors observed
* The earliest this bug was detected was QA Visual Regression tests build 372 (20th October) - https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/QA-QAVISUALMASTER-372/commit

Steps:

2. Login as a user who is admin but has access to only JIRA.

Result: The Welcome Dialog is not shown for the this admin. 

However when the admin has access to all apps.. it's there.
fields.summary: As an Admin that only has access to JIRA (but not other apps), I should see the JIRA welcome dialog

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Navigate to an open issue.
# Click 'resolve'.\\_The resolve issue dialog will open._
# Type a comment in the comment field. Do not submit the dialog.
# Open a separate browser window. Navigate to the same issue.
# Change the issue's status (for instance, from 'open' to 'in progress')
# Close this separate browser window.
# Back in the first window (with the dialog open), hit the submit ("Resolve") button.

Expected results:
* The comment field should still have my comment in it.

Actual results:
* Comment field empty.

Quite irritating that the fields that typically contain the most amount of user-entered data are always the ones that forget it all at the drop of a hat. Re-typing long comments is a massive pain.
fields.summary: Comment in issue transition dialog gets lost if issue was updated before submitting

fields.description:
*Repro Steps*
# Bulk edit issues from issue navigator
# Hover over "Cancel" button on "Bulk Edit" page

*Unexpected Behaviour*
On hover-over, the "Cancel" button displays an awkward border on the "Cancel" button. Please see http://screencast.com/t/jcKzMQHQSu77

The "Cancel" button for Bulk Edit should behave similarly to other "Cancel" buttons (e.g. Assign issue dialogue, and Edit issue dialogue) - please see http://screencast.com/t/DXmzDkcI8m

*Other notes*
The unexpected hover-over behaviour of Bulk Edit "Cancel" button is reproducible on the page for each step of Bulk Edit.
fields.summary: "Bulk Edit" page Cancel Button has unexpected hover-over behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30309].
  {panel}

If your commit has a well-formed git-style commit message like:
{noformat}PROJECT-1234: Convert baubles into trinkets

We previously used baubles to fill the shelves, but this limited the
number of items that could fit because baubles are fragile. Now, we
use trinkets instead, which are less expensive, and can be packed
into the shelves more efficiently.
{noformat}

...then if you hit the "Source" tab on the ticket mentioned, and use the {{+}} button to create a review in Crucible for that commit, then the review's title is something like {{PROJECT-1234: Convert baubles into trinkets We previously used baubles to fill the shel...}}.

It would probably be better to understand the message as a git-style commit message, and use the first line only, as that's what it's for.
fields.summary: Using "+" on a Jira ticket's "Source" tab to create a Crucible review results in an overly long review subject line

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# View the issue from which you want to create a link.
# On the 'view issue' page, select *Link* from the *More Actions* menu or if available, click the *Add Link* (plus) icon at the right of the *Issue Links* section.
# Click on the 'search for an issue' link.

*Expected Results:*
To be able to select multiple issues, by clicking the 'Select multiple issues' link. Checkboxes would appear, enabling multiple issues to be selected.
!linking-jira5-0.png!

*Actual Results:*
It is not possible to select multiple issues when searching for the issues(screenshot below), which was possible in JIRA 5.0 (screenshot above) and previous versions.
!linking-jira5-1.png!

*Workaround:*
# Search for the issues using the issue navigator and export them for Excel;
# Open the file and select all the issue keys under the *Key* column;
# Paste it into a text editor (e.g. notepad, notepad ++, etc.); select and copy all the issue keys (which will be displayed one in each line) 
# Paste it into the *Issue* field when linking the issues and click outside the field so all keys will be rendered.
[^Reference from Atlassian Answers^|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40224/bulk-action-link/40235]
fields.summary: Linking Issues - Not Possible to Select Multiple Issues

fields.description:
Hi,

when using a overly-long name for a component, the name is not wrapped after selection and can overlay the arrow-down-button used to view the available options.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create an overly long component e.g. "Overly-Complex-Component-Has-Overly-Complex-Name-And-We-Are-Sorry-About-This--Really-Sorry-You-Know"
# Create an issue with that component selected (if it does work at first, try resizing to 1024x768, though it does not seem to be important for this to happen)

I'm filing this bug against the component select, but we also got this problem after hack-converting other multi-selects to multi-select-dropdowns. While sounding a bit silly on component-field it is relevant on search-inputs.
Maybe you could fix this, having in mind you may want to use the same control for other things.

Regards

Matthias
fields.summary: Overly long components may overlay button of frother-control

fields.description:
I've got this problem when developing Structure plugin integration with GreenHopper. We have included our web-resource, which contains a rather large CSS, to be pulled up within gh-rapid web context. 

As a result, JIRA combined all CSS files into one batch:
/jira/s/..../_/download/contextbatch/css/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,atl.general/batch.css

This batch is 18,000 lines long and the number of rules exceeded 4096, which is the limit for one CSS file in IE8 and IE9.

As a result, half of the rules are lost and the application works incorrectly.
fields.summary: CSS superbatch may exceed 4096 rules, which is not supported by IE8 and IE9

fields.description:
During a restore basically we:

# Stop threads.
# Restore the database (aka wipe all tables and replace the with data from the restore).
# Stop the plugins system.
# Stop JIRA.
# ..

IMO Step 2 should be after Step 4 above. We need to give JIRA and/or plugins a chance to cleanup after themselves *before* its current DB is wiped. 

This is the cause of the exception below when I do a restore of the passed data [^TestUserQueriesCaseInsensitive.xml]. This NPE is thrown when the UPM tries to remove a service that it installed that exists in memory by not in the database. The NPE does not seem to cause any problems because we catch the exception, however, this is just one problem that can occur.

fields.description:
When Jira Administration-\->System-\->Webhooks page is loaded, the plugin throws the following exception:
 java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00932: inconsistent datatypes: expected - got CLOB

The same behavior is seen when a test webhook is created and attempted to be saved.

Apparently, the AO table for the webhooks plugin is being queried with String values for the fields Name, URL, Filter. By changing the data types of these fields from CLOB to Varchar2(767) it is possible to avoid the exception.

The stacktrace is here: 
http://pastie.org/5134086
fields.summary: Webhooks plugin throws SQL inconsistent datatypes error
Create new JQL function currentSprint().start

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30293].
  {panel}

When replying to an e-mail that was sent to create a JIRA issue, instead of adding a comment to the related issue, as it should according to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-Issue/commentcreation], the reply e-mail is creating a new JIRA issue.
As he does not find the JIRA Issue Key in the e-mail subject, he should check the in-reply-to header of the e-mail to see if the first e-mail of the chain created an issue, and it seems the system is not doing that.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Send an e-mail to create and issue with a Cc to yourself or another e-mail.
## This e-mail has the example ID: 1234
# Wait for the issue to be created.
## JIRA replies with an e-mail that has the example ID: ABCD
# Now, using the CC address, just reply the email with ID: 1234 that created the issue.

The handler is not following the In-reply-to ID.

Expected behavior - The reply should be added as a comment to the issue.
Actual behavior - The reply is creating a new issue. (Duplicated one)
fields.summary: Duplicating issue when replying to e-mail

fields.description:
The source code of the rpc-jira-plugin is absent from the source distribution, even though it is a bundled plugin:

{code}
jclark@BLUETONGUE /e/source_distros
$ cd atlassian-jira-5.1.7-source/

jclark@BLUETONGUE /e/source_distros/atlassian-jira-5.1.7-source
$ find . -name rpc-jira-plugin -print

jclark@BLUETONGUE /e/source_distros/atlassian-jira-5.1.7-source
$
{code}

The JIRA RPC Plugin's source code is normally accessible via [https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/atlassian/rpc-jira-plugin], but is currently restricted due to some release issues.

This means that currently there is no way for external developers to view this code, which is problematic because the plugin source also contains the example Java SOAP Client that we link to on the JIRA SOAP tutorial - https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Creating+a+JIRA+SOAP+Client

Exposing the full, canonical repo for the plugin is probably overkill - people generally just need to see the code as it stands in a particular JIRA version.
fields.summary: rpc-jira-plugin is missing from JIRA Source Distribution
We shouldn't show the "Create dialog" you are on the create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30281].
  {panel}

As an administrator, I do not want to be required to input an email address for a JIRA user. Requiring an email has resulted in email spamming and looping when you have email via comments setup. 

First issue. 
Since you cannot remove a user that is associated with any item, you have to replace the email with something  If they are invalid and someone puts a comment on a page, and notification services are utilized for notifying people involved - then it sends an email to this invalid user.  This results in a reply that you have sent to an invalid user which is added as a comment on the issue since it replied back to JIRA and includes the JIRA issue in the subject.  Since this invalid email comment is added to this issue, it sends another email out....thus, a loop of emails that is never ending

Second issue. 
We have set up some generic users to identify roles.  For example, we setup users for roles of implementation manager, integration engineer, developer, etc.  This identifies who is responsible for the issue and indicates whose role it is in queue for. Then, as in KanBan model, you pick up from the top of what is available and assign it to yourself.  Thus, you can always see what is ready for that role and assigned/not assigned; these are also often used when we set up template issues/subtasks.  Then, once cloned, they will make the specific assignments. 

Again, these generic role users require a user ID.  We set them up with a valid email that is aliased. However, whomever it is aliased to must now manage that inbox to delete the emails as they are really invalid emails. 

The preference is 1) either make the email address an option for an admin to identify as required or not or 2) not make it required as all. 

Either way, it puts the option into the hands of the customer administrator to understand what happens if they don't input an email (e.g. that person doesn't receive email notifications) which, in my opinion, is pretty clear and self-explanatory.  However, by not requiring it, you avoid all of the email spam and additional management.
fields.summary: Not require email for user

fields.description:
I downloaded a clean 5.1.7 standalone to test an upgrade task I had written - when starting I get the following error - java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.slf4j.spi.LocationAwareLogger.log(Lorg/slf4j/Marker;Ljava/lang/String;ILjava/lang/String;[Ljava/lang/Object;Ljava/lang/Throwable; )

On following this through it is because I have AusKey installed (Australian Government Business Certificate software) and that puts all sorts of junk in the /usr/java/packages/lib/ext/ folder - the workaround is to download and use a private JRE in this case.

The problem here is that the system classloader has become corrupted with foreign entities. This is not limited to AusKey - anything which sticks unknown files into /usr/java/packages/lib/ext/ is likely to cause this problem. The main symptom of this is the classpath scanner error.

A proper fix would involve providing our own classloader and not using the system one.
fields.summary: JIRA 5.1.7 standalone does not start on Linux if AusKey has been installed

fields.description:
When having 2 FishEye instances integrated to a single JIRA, by certain FishEye Configuration, the Reviews tab will be missing from the Project Summary screen although the project has been mapped to a specific Crucible project:
!scshot1.png!

Steps to reproduce the project:
- Add a single FishEye instance, map a JIRA project to Crucible project(s). The configuration for the following is set to "ON":
-- Disable for unmapped JIRA Projects
-- Force Project Mappings
- The Reviews tab will appear for the mapped project, as expected:
!scshot2.png!
- Try to add another FishEye instance, with Crucible integration enabled
- The Reviews tab will be missing from the projects, and it's affecting the projects with mappings as well

Disabling the "Disable for unmapped JIRA Projects" option or removing the second FishEye instance seemed to fix the problem. 

Also tested the behavior in JIRA 5.1.5 with FishEye 2.7.7, and it seems that the problem is not reproducible with the versions.
fields.summary: The Reviews tab is missing in the Project Summary screen when having 2 FeCru instances integrated to JIRA

Certain image when uploaded into JIRA, the thumbnails creation are color inverted.

However, this issue is image specific and not easily reproducible with any images regardless of the image extension.

My guess is that JIRA is using an image library that does not recognized this special image type. The same issue is not observed when the same image is attached to Gmail or Flickr.

Same issue is also observed in Confluence.

h5. Workaround:
Convert the image to another image format would solve the problem.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30264].
  {panel}

Can we please get a feature to prevent duplicate comments & attachments being entered onto a ticket.

Maybe make this a option to enable via the administration section or java_opts.

Typically Atlassian Internal IT see duplicate content submission occurring from a mail loop between Jira and another ticketing system when email submission is enabled.

Something like a sha1sum of the content, comment/attachment ID and ticket ID, stored in an extra table in the database would be required.

New content being entered could then sha1sum'd before being saved and the hash could be checked against existing sha1sums of the comments & attachments on that issue already.
fields.summary: sha1sum the content of comments & attachments to prevent duplicate comments & attachments

Currently, the Activity Stream retrieves the avatars for the updates depending on the application which Application Links are set.

For example, the user has set a custom avatar in JIRA, but is using the default avatar in FishEye. 
In the Activity Stream, sometimes the user sees his JIRA avatar, and sometimes his FishEye avatar. This is dependent on where the update came from.  If the update came from JIRA, then it will show his custom JIRA avatar. However, if the update came from FishEye, then it will show the default FishEye avatar, even if it is the same user in both sides.

This could cause some confusion. It would be useful if the user has a choice to determine the source for Activity Stream to retrieve avatars, for example to only take the avatars from JIRA.

# Create a new issue type, with custom large image other than default images - either by URL or custom uploaded image (e.g. http://editthis.info/images/wuw_archive/5/50/IGI-ARI!.gif, or konata_awesome.jpg (attached to issue))
# Add the new issue type (from step 1) to an issue type scheme
# Go to either of the following pages:
** the Manage Issue Type Schemes page
** Edit page of an issue type scheme

*Unexpected behaviour*
Icon for new issue type created is not scaled on the pages specified above:

*Manage Issue Type Schemes page:* 

!manage_issue_type_schemes_page.png!

*Edit page of an issue type scheme:* 

!modify_issue_type_scheme_page.png!

The icon should display as scaled, similar to the Issue Type picker / Frother:

!expected_icon_appearance.png!
fields.summary: Large custom Issue Type icon not scaled on Issue Type Scheme pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30251].
  {panel}

Using iOS 6.0 devices, content of JIRA Mobile(JM) is not scrollable smoothly as it is possible in Confluence Mobile (CM).

Although JM looks like it has same interface as CM, but its behavior is different on long contents. 

With CM, it displays vertical scrollbar which allows user to scroll with flicking(or throwing).

Somehow, JM does NOT allow vertical scrollbar causing sticky scrolling experience.


Also, it makes Safari or Chrome crash when its content is very long, and if user try to open Configuration button or Side pane. 
Although crashing mobile browser is not responsibility of JM,
JM seems to render somewhat broken HTML entities causing crash and anti-scrolling.

Thank you.
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile is not scrollable smoothly with iOS devices.

fields.description:
Under specials environment (sorry hard to reproduce, but I'm happy to show it on my computer) creating an user with special characters (outside of ASCII range) leads to an error.

My analysis is that we use UTF-8 based URL but the server try to decode with a ISO-8859-? charset. I debugged a little bit and it seems that the decoding of request parameters is done before any character encoding is defined on the request object. It looks like Tomcat use ISO-8859-1 by default.
fields.summary: UTF-8 based url decoded with ISO-8859 charset

fields.description:
h1. Symptom

Getting the following error when trying to view a profile page:

{noformat}
jiraschema.userhistoryitem (ID, entitytype, entityid, USERNAME, lastviewed, data) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Cannot insert duplicate key row in object 'jiraschema.userhistoryitem' with unique index 'uh_type_user_entity'.))
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:UserHistoryItem][id,10374][username,admin][data,null][entityId,admin][lastViewed,1350569188345][type,Assignee] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraschema.userhistoryitem (ID, entitytype, entityid, USERNAME, lastviewed, data) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Cannot insert duplicate key row in object 'jiraschema.userhistoryitem' with unique index 'uh_type_user_entity'.))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:379)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.OfBizUserHistoryStore.addHistoryItemNoChecks(OfBizUserHistoryStore.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.CachingUserHistoryStore$2.run(CachingUserHistoryStore.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ManagedLocks$ManagedLockImpl.withLock(ManagedLocks.java:333)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.CachingUserHistoryStore.addHistoryItem(CachingUserHistoryStore.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.SessionBasedAnonymousUserHistoryStore$2.run(SessionBasedAnonymousUserHistoryStore.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ManagedLocks$ManagedLockImpl.withLock(ManagedLocks.java:333)
{noformat}

h2. Cause

If a user's name changes case and you are connected to a database that does case insensitive comparison (e.g. MSSQL 2008 as setup following the steps on https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/CpX2Cw). The most common way for a user's name to change is for it to change in an external user directory where case is important (e.g. some LDAP servers).

h2. Steps 

* Setup JIRA to an LDAP directory.
* Create a user with username "testuser" in the internal JIRA directory.
* Login with username "testuser"
* Go to the user's profile page.
* Inside the LDAP directory, create a user "TestUser".
* Move the LDAP directory to the top.
* (BUG) Go to the current user's profile page. You will get the above exception.
fields.summary: Getting 'duplicate key' database error when trying to look at a user's profile page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30246].
  {panel}

As a lot of other users do with JIRA we bundle groups of issues into new Release Versions.  Each one of these issues is reviewed and receives an IMT Sign off as well as a Business Sign Off.  The purpose of the Business Sign-Off is to have a record of validation that the Business Units are aware and consent to the changes IMT is implementing. 

The problem is for most situations the business does not want to "Approve" each issue separately since they tend to not understand each technical change listed under each issue.  

Therefore It would be nice if we were able to have an approval happen on the Version from a group/user instead of having it done on each ticket.  

Thanks
fields.summary: Version Workflow/ Version Approval
Have JIRA Search Function Return Results When Searching Legacy Issue Keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30244].
  {panel}

I am implementing Jira at a large company and we are looking to migrate a project that is currently hosted at a vendor site.  After a few hours iterative importing/exporting via csv I have 90% of what I need, but the remaining 10% is important and not available:

# Comments (showstopper): I can't export/import all/any comments via csv, and this is a dealbreaker as all issues have a variety of comments. Workaround = https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/it.skyit.jira.plugins.all-comments-cf
# Watchers (High): Similar to comments I would like to be able to export/import all the watchers of a given issue via csv

This just leaves attachments, which obviously can't be exported via CSV but hopefully I can get the Vendor to have them all copied over here.
fields.summary: Jira missing 3 items to easily import/export issues via csv from one project instance to another

Currently it is possible pull more information with using expand in your call, for example:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/JRA-22053?expand=changelog

The problem is that at times this provides too much information provided when using ?expand.  This is a request to implement limitation parameters to better define the results.

These limitations actually already exist for REST search requests, aka *startAt* and *maxResults*, but these parameters do not currently work with the expansion function.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30236].
  {panel}

At the moment, you can only specify the search query based on keywords (such as project, fixVersion, etc).  It would be a great addition to the Advanced Search if a user can search based on the count number of a particular keyword.  For example, a user can search for issues that have 2 or more fix versions, or search for issues that have 2 or more labels.

As an example, a user provide the following scenario:

{quote}
Say I have :

    issue KEY-1 with fix version 1.0.0
    issue KEY-2 with fix version 1.1.0 and 1.2.0
    issue KEY-3 with fix version 1.1.0 and 1.3.0
    issue KEY-4 with fix version 1.0.0 and 2.0.0

I want to query for issues that have 2 fix versions (for example), independently of the names of the version itself
For example:

"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=2" => would return KEY-2,KEY-3,KEY-4
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=1" => would return KEY-1
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions>=1" => would return KEY-1,KEY-2,KEY-3,KEY-4
"project=KEY and nbFixVersions=3" => would return none
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the ability to return search result based on count

fields.description:
Both absolute and relative dates are being used inconsistently on the view issue page.

In the Dates panel, relative dates are used (for recent periods - up to a week I believe).

fields.description:
The Workload Pie Chart Report included with the JIRA charting plugin contains a number of XSS vulnerabilities. This plugin is bundled with OnDemand.

The configuration page contains an XSS vulnerability in custom field names.
1. Create a custom field with the name <script>alert('custom field')</script>
2. Try to create a workload pie chart report for a project
e.g. https://iceberg.jira-dev.com/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10002&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:workloadpie-report

The view page contains XSS vulnerabilities in a number of fields - at least assignee (though the username), project name and labels.
1. Create an issue adding the label <script>alert('label')</script> and giving it an estimated completion time
2. View a workload pie chart report for the project the issue is in, choosing the labels field as the statistic type

e.g. https://iceberg.jira-dev.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?projectOrFilterId=project-10002&statistictype=labels&issuetimetype=currentestimate&selectedProjectId=10002&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting%3Aworkloadpie-report&Next=Next

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30224].
  {panel}

When you use the JIRA Send Mail option, in the past (JIRA 4.4.5), JIRA just took the sender from the From field, which is the user's email address. Now, it's using the configured outgoing mail instead of the user's email address and appending the username of the user to the front.

Example:
* username *abcd1234* with full name ABCD and email address <abcd1234@company.com>
* JIRA's configured outgoing mail as <jira@company.com>

If ABCD sends an email:
* in JIRA 4.4.5, JIRA displays the sender as "abcd1234@company.com"
* now, JIRA displays the sender as "abcd1234 <jira@company.com>"
(i) what is expected is: "ABCD <abcd1234@company.com>"

(x) It looks like <jira@company.com> is always displayed no matter whether a reply-to email is specified or not

(/) However, if a user clicks on Reply from his mail client, the correct reply-to email will still be used instead of JIRA's configured outgoing mail.

{panel}Since some companies have user ids that do not give hints of the names, JIRA should append the Full Name instead. Apart from that, the user of displayed email address needs revising to minimize confusion.{panel}
fields.summary: Send Mail option could use Full Name instead of username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30215].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Attempt to bulk move issue types during edit of Issue Type Scheme fails with issue type not updated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start with a project using an _Issue Type Scheme_ with multiple issue types
 # Create _Issues_ associated to the issue types
 # Edit the _Issue Type Scheme_ associated with the project to change the issue types used or apply a new scheme with different issue types
 # A series of steps will now be presented to associate the issues with different issue types
 # For each step use the *enter* key to proceed to the next step
 # The _edit_ will fail with the error presented as above and browser showing a connection error.
 # On checking the project the issues will not have been migrated to the new issue types

h3. Expected Results

Issues will be migrated from the original issue type to the new chosen issue type as defined in the edited scheme.
h3. Actual Results

Issue types will not have been updated and the _atlassian-jira.log_ will display and error of type (log snippet from 8.5.1 instance)
{code:java}
http-nio-8451-exec-18 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/jira_path].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] in context with path [/jira_path] threw exception [java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to progress to bulk edit bean with index greater than 1. 2 bulk edit beans available] with root cause
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to progress to bulk edit bean with index greater than 1. 2 bulk edit beans available
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.MultiBulkMoveBeanImpl.progressToNextBulkEditBean(MultiBulkMoveBeanImpl.java:299)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.MigrateIssueTypes.doSetFields(MigrateIssueTypes.java:142)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
...
{code}
h3. Workaround

The workaround to ensure the issue types are updated is to *not* use the enter key to proceed through the update steps but to ensure the *next* key is clicked with the mouse.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit: Unable to progress with index greater than five.

fields.description:
Customers do not get all issues in a search they are allowed to access:

Steps to reproduce:
# Two users in this testing case:
#* 'admin' as administrator who belong to all project roles
#* 'amanda' as a user who belong to jira-users, and create a group named '1' add 'amanda' to this group 1
# Sign in as Administrator
#* Create a select list custom filed named "cust", and set two values "1" and "2".
#* Associate "cust" with create issue screen.
#* Create a project 'test' and set the *{{Issue Security}}* and *{{Browser Project}}* Permission as following:
{noformat}
Current Assignee
Group Custom Field Value (cust)
Reporter
{noformat}

# Create two issues:
#* TEST-1, Both Reporter and Assignee are admin, and choose 'cust' with value '1'
#* TEST-2, One of Reporter or Assignee is 'amanda' and choose 'cust' with value '1'
# Search in Advanced search with query: {noformat} cust = "1" {noformat}
#* Search by using user 'admin', you will see both issue.
#* Search by using user 'amanda', you will only see the issue which the 'Reporter' or 'Assignee' as amanda, but if you key in another issue's issue key TEST-1 in Quick Search, you will be able to view TEST-1. 

Note: If the user 'amanda' does not belong to group '1' which the group name is same with the custom filed 'cust' value's name '1', amanda will not able to view TEST-1 as she is not belong to reporter/assignee of this issue.

If user are able to view the issue which not assigned or reported by himself, but with the security level which contain the group custom field value, the user should also be able to search for all the issues which contain the custom filed value.
fields.summary: When you have a specific setup where issue-level view permission depends on a group in a custom field, then search doesn't show all issues you have permission to view
